org.mxupdate.update.datamodel
Class AbstractAttribute_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.update.AbstractObject_mxJPO
      org.mxupdate.update.AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO
          org.mxupdate.update.AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO
              org.mxupdate.update.datamodel.AbstractDMWithTriggers_mxJPO
                  org.mxupdate.update.datamodel.AbstractAttribute_mxJPO
Direct Known Subclasses:
AttributeBoolean_mxJPO, AttributeDate_mxJPO, AttributeInteger_mxJPO, AttributeReal_mxJPO, AttributeString_mxJPO
abstract class AbstractAttribute_mxJPO
extends AbstractDMWithTriggers_mxJPO

The class is used to evaluate information from attributes within MX used to export, delete and update an attribute.

Version:
$Id: AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.java 611 2009-11-02 00:20:36Z tim.moxter $
Author:
The MxUpdate Team

Field Detail

SELECT_ATTRS

private static final String SELECT_ATTRS
MQL list statement with select for the attribute type and name used to get the list of all attribute MX names depending on the attribute type.

See Also:
getMxNames(ParameterCache_mxJPO), Constant Field Values

TCL_PROCEDURE

private static final String TCL_PROCEDURE
Called TCL procedure within the TCL update to parse the new policy definition. The TCL procedure calls method jpoCallExecute(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String...) with the new policy definition. All quot's are replaced by @0@0@ and all apostroph's are replaced by @1@1@.

See Also:
update(ParameterCache_mxJPO, CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence, Map, File), jpoCallExecute(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String...), Constant Field Values

IGNORED_URLS

private static final Set<String> IGNORED_URLS
Set of all ignored URLs from the XML definition for attributes.

See Also:
parse(String, String)

rules

private final Set<String> rules
Set holding all rules referencing this attribute.

ranges

private final Stack<AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.Range> ranges
Stores the ranges of the attribute (used while parsing the XML attribute).

See Also:
parse(String, String)

rangeProgramRef

private String rangeProgramRef
If the range is a program the value references a program. Only one range program could be defined at maximum! So the range program is defined as variable directly on the attribute and not as range.

See Also:
parse(String, String), rangeProgramInputArguments, AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.Range.write(Appendable)

rangeProgramInputArguments

private String rangeProgramInputArguments
If the range is a program the value are the input arguments.

See Also:
parse(String, String), rangeProgramRef, AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.Range.write(Appendable)

rangesSorted

private final Set<AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.Range> rangesSorted
All ranges but sorted after they are prepared.

See Also:
ranges, prepare(ParameterCache_mxJPO)

                       throws matrix.util.MatrixException

Overrides:

Parameters:

Returns:
set of MX names of all attributes of attribute type attrTypeList
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the query for attribute objects failed
See Also:
SELECT_ATTRS, attrTypeList

parse

protected void parse(String _url,
                     String _content)
The method parses the attribute specific XML urls. This includes information about:
  • assigned rules (see rules)
  • default value (see defaultValue)
  • is the attribute multiline (see multiline)
  • attribute type (see type)
  • defined ranges (see ranges, rangeProgramRef and rangeProgramInputArguments

Overrides:
parse in class AbstractDMWithTriggers_mxJPO
Parameters:
_url - URL to parse
_content - content of the URL to parse
See Also:
IGNORED_URLS

create

public void create(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache)
            throws Exception
Creates given attribute from given type with given name. Because the type of the attribute must defined, the original create method must be overwritten.

Overrides:
create in class AbstractAdminObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
Throws:
Exception - if the new attribute for given type could not be created
See Also:
attrTypeCreate

update

protected void update(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                      CharSequence _preMQLCode,
                      CharSequence _postMQLCode,
                      CharSequence _preTCLCode,
                      Map<String,String> _tclVariables,
                      File _sourceFile)
               throws Exception
The method overwrites the original method to append the MQL statements in the _preMQLCode to reset this attribute. This includes:
  • set to not hidden
  • reset description and default value
  • remove all ranges
  • define the TCL procedure TCL_PROCEDURE to set the dimension
  • if the dimension is not updated within the TCL update file (tested with dimensionUpdated) method updateDimension(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String) is called

Overrides:
update in class AbstractDMWithTriggers_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_preMQLCode - MQL statements which must be called before the TCL code is executed
_postMQLCode - MQL statements which must be called after the TCL code is executed
_preTCLCode - TCL code which is defined before the source file is sourced
_tclVariables - map of all TCL variables where the key is the name and the value is value of the TCL variable (the value is automatically converted to TCL syntax!)
_sourceFile - souce file with the TCL code to update
Throws:
Exception - if the update from derived class failed
See Also:
AbstractAttribute_mxJPO.Range.remove4Update(Appendable), updateDimension(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String), dimensionUpdated, TCL_PROCEDURE

jpoCallExecute

public void jpoCallExecute(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                           String... _args)
                    throws Exception
The method is called from the TCL update code to define the dimension for this attribute. If the correct use case is defined method updateDimension(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String) is called.

Overrides:
jpoCallExecute in class AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_args - first index defines the use case (must be "defineAttrDimension" that the dimension of the attribute is updated); second index the name of the attribute to update; third index the new dimension to set
Throws:
Exception - if the update of the dimension failed or for all other use cases from super JPO call
See Also:
updateDimension(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String), dimensionUpdated

updateDimension

protected void updateDimension(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                               String _dimension)
                        throws Exception
Updates the dimension of this attribute. If a dimension is already defined for this attribute and it is not the same attribute, an exception is thrown (because information could be lost).

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_dimension - new dimension to set
Throws:
Exception - if update failed or the dimension of an update should be changed (and some information could be lost)
See Also:
jpoCallExecute(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String...), update(ParameterCache_mxJPO, CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence, Map, File)
